Name: Tårtkalaset
Description:
In this game waits the most delicious cream cake on you and your opponents. And the best part is that you can take as many pieces of the cake that you wants without having stomach problems. In your hand you can carry cards of strawberries , candy and many more ingredients. The person who have taken the most pieces of the cake will win this game.

Contents:
1 boardgame
1 cream cake (16 pieces and a marzipanrose in the middle)
48 candy cards
1 dice
1 recipe
Rules inside of the front box.

Name: The Haunted Musicians
Description:
You are composers, haunted by music that you didn't write, and also doesn't exist. As such, all of you are in an asylum. To regain your sanity, you have to complete three of the compositions haunting you. Unfortunately, there are only so much paper and ink available  at a time. Also, the asylum tries to keep as many of its patients in group therapy at a time as it can.

Players invest their tempo(represented by metronomes) to obtain the materials, time, and inspiration needed to complete the pieces haunting them. There are currently two card decks, one for 3-4 players and one for 5-6.

Name: Sune och ryska posten
Description:
In the Sunes room there is the entry to the closet. While you're in there you will play a Russian postman who gives away dare, hugs or kisses, but you wont know to whom your giving it to.

Contents:
1 boardgame
10 tiles with persons on it
100 cards
5 playing pieces
1 dice
1 rule sheet

Name: Spöken och Monster
Description:
Do you dare to enter this monster castle? In the castle some terrible monsters will wait for you such as Greve Cranium, Ms bat, Frankenstein, Kryptonia and many more. The house is full with bats, spiders, craniums and chests. Can you lay the puzzle and find the creature in the castle before anyone else? Then you will escape with your life and the other are doomed for the eternity.

Contents:
The box as a boardgame
1 bat
1 spider
1 chest with 20 puzzle pieces
1 cranium
1 book storytelling of Greve Cranium 
34 cards
2 dice

Name: Super Games
Description:
The game with a lot of challenges. You have to prove your self worthy in 15 different challenges to get around the board. Do you have what it takes to get to the finish line?
Do you feel just lucky or are you a master of tactics in the challenges?

Will you master basket, skating, golf, throwing rings, number games, spelling games, higher or lower, quiz just to mention some of the challenges.

Name: Scene It? Doctor Who
Description:
Scene It? - Doctor Who takes the mechanic of the base Scene It?: The DVD Movie Game game and specializes to Doctor Who TV series trivia.

As in previous versions of Scene It?: The DVD Movie Game games, the players select pawns and move along a board answering trivia questions. There are three categories of questions on the question cards, and there are many categories of questions on the DVD which includes clips from the Doctor Who TV series.

This game features only the Doctor Who TV series starring David Tennant.

Name: Empires: Builder Expansion
Description:
An official expansion to Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery, the Empires: Builder Expansion contains:

1) A NEW SPECIALIST: THE BUILDER
Abilities:
a) When placed on the colonist dock and sent to the New World it will increase the VP's scored for the region: +4 VP/Builder (of any color) for 1st place; +2 VP/Builder for second place. (The idea is that the colony is much more developed with cities and infrastructure).
b) When placed in the Capital Building track, the player pays $5 less.

The Builder may be acquired via new Capital Buildings or when a player places a colonist on the 5th spot (Builder is Free, other specialists cost 5)

2) 20 NEW CAPITAL BUILDINGS
These include some "buildings" that cost zero, but offer a one-time instant effect such as $7, 2 free specialists, and 2 free trade goods.  So even if a player is short on cash, a building action is available.

3) A RULES SHEET with the new Builder Rules, Capital Buildings, and even special rules for a historical start (Each Nation has a special ability and one or two Capital Buildings to start the game). The idea is that the Spanish will feel like the Spanish (Conquistadors, etc.), The English will feel like the English, the Dutch like the Dutch, etc.

4) The MINT and OVERPOPULATION will, indeed be a part of the new expansion.

5) Expands the game to 6 players with a Complete set of purple colonists

Name: Quatorze
Description: Players try to remove groups of cards, but they can only remove a group of cards if the total adds up to 14, and if they are in the same row or the same column.

Name: Korps Commander WW 2: The Road to Berlin
Description:
From the introduction to the rules:

Road to Berlin is a set of rules in the Korps Commander series, which will eventually cover all periods of warfare at a level which will allow large battles and campaigns to be fought. The series' aim is to utilize the techniques of boardgaming whilst retaining the flavour of miniature gaming.

Road to Berlin simulates actions in the Second World War on the Western or Eastern Fronts during the final two years for forces up to Corps or Army levels.

The basic units in the game are tank and mechanized infantry platoons, infantry companies, and artillery batteries. Aircraft may be in flights or squadrons, Logistics and engineers are fully covered.

A Corps level assault can easily be played on an 8' x 6' table, whilst the rules are ideal for campaign games where the action is spread across a number of tables.

Name: The Silver Dollar City Game
Description: This is a roll and move for 2-6 players, based on the amusement park in Branson, MO. There are two ways to play, Basic & Advanced. In the Basic game players travel around the park and the winner is the first person to land on the finish  space by exact roll. In the Advanced game players travel around the board gathering as much money as possible. Once all players have traveled the board, the winner is the one with the most money.

Name: Das Kabinett des Königs
Description:
A game contained in Spielbox #86 (Feb/Mar 2009)
Players must supply nine markers in each of two colors and a figure to use for the king.
(rough translation from description)
The Cabinet of Kings
A new king has come to power.  He must recruit the best members of society for his cabinet.  Who will get the most valuable seats in the cabinet.

This game is for two players who either place potential cabinet members on the board or move the king to recruit members.  Some spots in the cabinet are worth more points than others, so players attempt to grab the best seats for their candidates, but cannot give up too many of the less valuable ones.

Name: Around the House Treasure Hunt Game
Description:
This game is a family game that puts a pirate themed spin on the cooperative treasure hunt.  Players get one of several secret riddles printed up on scrolls.  Once they solve the riddle and find the correct location, they then need to solve the next riddle they find there, and so on, until they find the hidden bag of treasure coins.

Game components:
-Game Box that looks just like a treasure chest
-Fabric Treasure Map
-Velour drawstring bag with nicely printed jolly roger
-Plastic Gold coins
-30 scrolls with riddles
-instructions.

Name: Al Pha Bet
Description:
This game's deck has 60 cards, in 5 colored suits: black is all vowels, while red, blue, yellow and green have one 'E' and the rest consonants.  In most of the games, black is considered wild, belonging to any color.  There four games described.

Al Pha Bet: All are dealt 7 cards.  In a turn, a player draws 1 from the draw or discard pile, lays down a word or passes, and discards down to 7 if needed.  Each word scores 5 per black vowel (there must be at least 1 per word), plus 1 per colored letter if there are at least 2 of them and they're all the same color; all doubled if the word is a palindrome (spelling another word backwards).  Game ends after the draw pile's gone and all pass; highest total wins.

Alpha: Deal 7 face up to each player.  In a turn, a player draws 1 and makes a word or passes and discards down to 7.  If a word is played, each other player in turn gets a chance to add cards from their hand to the played word to make a different word, without changing the order.  The last to add to the word wins it.  Words score 1 per letter, doubled if monochrome, doubled if a palindrome.

Beta: A solitaire game.  Deal 6 cards out in a line, starting 6 columns.  You may move individual cards to the top of bottom of another column, removing words as completed.  When done moving, deal another card to the bottom of each column (or empty slot if a column is empty).  Continue until the deck is gone, trying to eliminate the whole deck.

Capa: A bridge-like partnership trick-taking game.  Players first bid the number of words to make, along with a color (not black).  Highest bid gets his color as trump, and his partner is dummy.  Player to his left leads first.  All plays must follow suit if possible, unless black is led.  If a word is made in the color led, the leader wins the trick; if a word is made in a different color or multiple colors, the one who added the last card to it wins; if no word is made the leader wins.  If the contractors get as many words as bid, they score for all words won, else the opponents score for all the words they won; words are scored as in Alpha.

Name: World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Brebo Bigshot Character Pack
Description:
In the  World of Warcraft , there are many heroes and many perils. As each foe falls, a new enemy is revealed; as each hero falters a new champion stands forth. Now, new heroes have risen to take their place in the Hall of Legends!

Brebo Bigshot, a Gnome mage, sets the landscape ablaze with his devastating fire magic abilities. His arcane prowess provides him magical armors and the power to incinerate foes with fiery attacks, even able to turn an opponent into a Living Bomb!

Not a complete game. A copy of World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game is required to play.

Game Contents:
28 Challenge Cards 
23 Ability Cards 
9 Character Tokens 
4 Character Cards 
1 Character Miniature 
4 Quests 
4 Discover Tokens

Name: WhizORD
Description:
WhizORD  deck has 108 cards, each having a letter of the alphabet, and a value from 1-10, rarer letters being worth more.  Rules for several games are included:

Poker-WhizORD: Like draw poker with 7 cards and one draw per hand.  The player with the highest-scoring words adds it to his total.  Alternate rules add chips and betting typical to poker, with up to 3 rounds of betting.

Soli-WhizORD: A solitaire game.  Player deals himself 10 hands as if in Poker-WhizORD -- including one draw -- and scores their best word.  The goal is 300 points.

Rummy-WhizORD: Players have 7-card hands, and in each turn they play and score a word or pass and discard any number of cards; then they draw back up to 7.  Winner is the first to an agreed total.

Thirty-WhizORD: Players start with 7-card hands, and in their turn draw 1 and discard 1.  The first player with a 30-point word in hand calls "Thirty!", lays it down and wins the hand.  Play to an agreed number of hands or wins.

Hangman-WhizORD: Players each think of a word with the same number of letters, and pick their letters out of the deck, laying them out face down in the opponent's reading order.  Take turns guessing letters, correct guesses being revealed, incorrect guesses being noted to avoid repeats.  You may guess the word but if guessed wrong you lose; otherwise the first one to expose all the opponent's letters wins.

Match'Em-WhizORD: 12 or more matching pairs of letters are pulled from the deck, suffled and laid out on the table.  Players reveal 2 cards in their turn, keeping matches, as in Concentration/Pelmanism.

Precitd-WhizORD: One card is revealed.  Each player reveals another card in turn, but first predicts whether their card will precede or follow the first card.  The player who predicted correctly, and has the letter closest to the first letter, captures all the cards; no one wins if a tie or a card matches the first one.  At the end of the deck, the most cards captured wins.

Name: World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Wennu Bloodsinger Character Pack
Description:
In the World of Warcraft, there are many heroes and many perils. As each foe falls, a new enemy is revealed; as each hero falters a new champion stands forth. Now, new heroes have risen to take their place in the Hall of Legends!

Weenu Bloodsinger, a Troll priest, has devoted herself, body and soul, to the powers of shadow magic. Her unwavering faith in the world of shadow manifests as power words, shadow words, and other terrifying miracles. Using her shadowform, she possesses the eerie, vampire-like ability to drain her opponent of life, leaving nothing behind but a desiccated husk.

Not a complete game. A copy of World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game is required to play.

Game Contents:
28 Challenge Cards 
23 Ability Cards 
9 Character Tokens 
4 Character Cards 
1 Character Miniature 
4 Quests 
4 Discover Tokens

Name: World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Shailara Witherblade Character Pack
Description:
In the World of Warcraft, there are many heroes and many perils. As each foe falls, a new enemy is revealed; as each hero falters a new champion stands forth. Now, new heroes have risen to take their place in the Hall of Legends!

Shailara Witherblade, a Night Elf warrior, has mastered the art of armored combat, gliding seamless between offense and defense, between parry and strike. Her relentless training has prepared her to capitalize on her foe's missteps with instant retaliation. Few would dare cross swords with this proud warrior!

Not a complete game. A copy of World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game is required to play.

Game Contents:
28 Challenge Cards 
23 Ability Cards 
9 Character Tokens 
4 Character Cards 
1 Character Miniature 
4 Quests 
4 Discover Tokens

Name: World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game – Thundershot Character Pack
Description:
In the World of Warcraft, there are many heroes and many perils. As each foe falls, a new enemy is revealed; as each hero falters a new champion stands forth. Now, new heroes have risen to take their place in the Hall of Legends!

Thundershot, a Tauren hunter, prowls through the night with the aid of cunning traps and his ferocious pet wolf, Bardolph. In addition to his deadly accuracy as an archer, his mind is so keenly in tune with the natural world he takes on the aspects of wild beasts to help track down his quarry.

Not a complete game. A copy of World of Warcraft: The Adventure Game is required to play.

Game Contents:
28 Challenge Cards 
23 Ability Cards 
9 Character Tokens 
4 Character Cards 
1 Character Miniature 
4 Quests 
4 Discover Tokens

Name: Count Your Peanuts! Math Game
Description:
From the box:

"We’ve made counting practice more fun than ever, with a super-involving game kids will love to play! Children just roll the die to move around the board collecting or giving away cute peanuts along the way. At the finish line, kids count up the peanuts in their bags and the player with the most peanuts wins the game! 2-4 players; with 4 rugged vinyl bags, plastic peanuts and more. Game board is 16" x 16".

Name: Quackers! Hide and Seek Game
Description:
From the box:

"Which of these silly ducks is hiding the secret egg? Just follow the quacking sound as the ducks spin ’round and ’round! But be sure to grab the right duck or you may end up with the rotten egg! Game includes all you need for up to 6 players; spinning nest measures 10".

Name: The Big Spin Game Show
Description:
From the Box:

"A real live game show you can host right in your own home! The Big Spin game lets contestants answer intriguing questions in 4 key categories: math, science, language and the arts. Kids just spin the wheel to select a category and earn points for each correct answer. The 14 1/2" write & wipe game board lets you tally up points as you play, and the game cards each have 3 different questions that vary in difficulty so kids of all abilities can play! With 80 game cards and a dry-erase marker. "

Name: Fact Finders! Dino Builders Game
Description:
From the box:

"Kids piece these cool dinos together fact by fact! To play, kids answer fascinating questions about their favorite prehistoric reptiles, spin the spinner and collect plastic bones to build their own T-Rex or stegosaurus! You get 40 question cards, plus simple photo cards showing how to put the dinos together. T-Rex is 18 1/2".

Name: Science Stadium Strategy Game
Description:
From the box:

"Kids try to guess their opponent’s secret card and discover tons of cool creatures along the way from a Boa Constrictor and Bottlenose Dolphin to a Komodo Dragon! Played like 20 Questions, our game features 160 photo cards with fun facts on back like each animal’s size, diet, habitat and more. Kids just ask yes or no questions until they identify the other player’s animal and win the game! With two 11" game stadiums that hold the cards in place as children play."

Name: Soccer Shootout
Description:
From the box:

"With a super-strong leg that kicks the ball over 16 feet, this soccer star can score from anywhere on the field! Simply rotate his leg to angle the kick, then softly tap on his head to shoot short distances or whack him harder for extra-long shots. But watch out for the goalie as your opponent tries to block each shot and keep you from scoring! Comes complete with a scoreboard, 2 soft foam balls and 9 distance markers. Sturdy plastic goal is 15 1/2".

Name: Republican
Description:
A word card game with a mild political theme.  The deck has 52 letter cards, and 2 jokers which can stand for periods or  apostrophes in contractions or abbreviations.  (There is an elephant on the back of each card, and a donkey on the front of the jokers.)  An extra deck is recommended if more than 3 play.

Players are dealt 10 cards, and the top of the draw is turned over to start the discard pile.  In a turn a player draw one from either pile and discards one.  If they think they have a winning hand they "call a vote", and everyone lays down their hands to score.  The player with the highest-scoring hand adds its points, plus a 10-point bonus, to their total.  Play to 150 points for the win.

One or more words can be formed from the hand when scoring, but the points favor longer words.  Each word scores the "triangle number" of the number of letters it contains: 
1 - 1
2 - 3
3 - 6
4 - 10
5 - 15
6 - 21
7 - 28
8 - 36
9 - 45
10 - 55

There are several possible bonuses: a player who can use all his hand to spell words may "vote his hand" (similar to going Gin), automatically winning the hand and getting a 20-point bonus.  Spelling certain Reward Words:
  WORK, THRIFT, PROFIT, YOU, WIN
earns double its point count.  Spelling certain 10-letter Winning Words:
  REPUBLICAN, PATRIOTISM, CAPITALISM, PRODUCTION
earns 150 points and wins the game outright.

Name: Atak Dinozaurów
Description:
Description from box back translated from Polish:

Meet eye to eye with dangerous dinosaurs!!! Learn and master the habits each of them and trail the most dangerous - Tyrannosaurus. When you finish pursuit of the lord of prehistoric animals - try your force, playing cards with the most interesting and dangerous reptiles.

Box Content:
game board, 32 cards with dinosaurs, Tyrannosaurus card, 8 big mat to colour, 4 pawns, dice, rules

Name: Nuthin' But Net
Description:
In the grand tradition of miniature sports games such as Blood Bowl, comes Nuthin But Net! a board game of three-on-three basketball for fantasy races which range from standard humans, to elves, ratmen, and lizard folk.

Each player has a team of five, each with unique stats for skills such as ball handling, shooting and dunking, Three players are on the half-court at a time, and the action is fast and furious as you play to a win, usually 21 points.

Now produced by Impact! Miniatures www.impactminiatures.com

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – A Time of Trials
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

"All she wanted was to go home, but leaving King's Landing was not so easy as she had hoped. She had been sleeping in Flea Bottom, on rooftops, and in stables, wherever she could find a place to lie down, and it hadn't taken her long to learn that the district was well named..."

A Time of Trials is the second monthly installment of sixty fixed cards for the "King's Landing" expansion to A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, based on George R.R. Martin's best-selling A Song of Ice and Fire saga. It contains three copies each of twenty different never-before-seen cards designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Games of Thrones metagame.

"King's Landing" cycle:

- City of Secrets
- A Time of Trials
- The Tower of the Hand
- Tales from the Red Keep
- Secrets and Spies
- The Battle of Blackwater Bay
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Pronto Bronto
Description: Five large wooden dinosaurs are moving towards trees and picking up one tree from each corner of the game board. All dinosaurs which get back to their starting square before the (neutral) T-Rex gets there is a winner. Dinosaurs are moved by a color die which determines the color of the next square they can move to.

Name: Mythomachy
Description:
Mythology is a subject of never-ending fascination! Myths of creation, of floods, of heroes - these and many others crop up in the myths of numerous cultures throughout the world. Mythology has inspired painters, sculptors, writers and other artists over the centuries.

Now, world mythology is encompassed, as is reasonably possible, within Mythomachy, the top educational, brain development and family-friendly entertaining brand designed to teach children about mythology as well as to help them discover new ways to foster their intelligence. Mythomachy intends to be represented across all major categories of youth products with focus on toys, publishing and other consumer product categories, including apparel, accessories, back-to-school and more as this exciting property has enormous branding and licensing potential for the boy and girl audience.

There is a lot of excitement behind Mythomachy Trading Card Game distributed first across retail venues nationwide in Greece. Unlike most trading card games, which are based on fantasy, Mythomachy is solidly anchored in the global universe of authentic myths and legends.

Mythomachy TCG first edition includes a 350-card set available in 6-card booster packs, providing a tremendous base of consumer-tested artwork and game play, taking into account the age-sensitive profile of its target, kids Ages 7 and up.

In an already male-saturated market, Mythomachy is enjoyed as much by female fans as male because of its directly educational quality profile and learning benefits.

Name: Pocahontas Adventure VCR Game
Description:
"The game you can play while you watch your 'Pocahontas' video!"

(c)1996

Players move around a colorful board as they watch the movie. When certain events occur during the film players take Canoe Cards or Grandmother Willow cards from the deck. These cards are used to help the players get to the finish line and win the game.

Includes board, spinner, cards, tokens, and a package of Nestle Quik!

Name: Horrible Science Seriously Squishy Games
Description:
A compendium of 4 games to accompany the Horrible Science collection of books. Contains:

- Spiders and twigs game: A straight roll and move with plastic bugs for counters.

- Spitting Cobra: Use the water pistol to try to hit the squishy eyeball.

- Archer Fish: Use the water pistol to try to hit the plastic bugs.

- Queen Bee!: A hex based draughts/checkers variant.

Name: Echelon
Description:
Echelon is a three-dimensional abstract strategy game in which two players build a structure while attempting to get five cubes of their own color in a row.

Starting with a black "starting cube", players alternate placing in one of two ways:

1) Playing three cubes in a row (as viewed from above), with at least one cube on top of a preexisting one, or;

2) Playing two cubes as above, but also removing an edge-adjacent cube from the structure.

The game also includes two "anchor cubes" of each color, which may not be removed from play by either player, as well as one "shift cube" for each, which may only be removed by the owning player.

Note: the front of the package claims the game is suitable for 2-4 players, but the interior of the rulebook reveals that doing so entails purchasing another set of cubes (they were apparently sold in two sets; one with red and blue cubes, and the other with green and purple).

Name: Ab ins Bett, Nils!
Description:
Bertie doesn’t want to go to bed; he wants to play just a bit longer. So the children play with him!

The little hippo shows children a first color identification and memory game.

Name: Cardigan and Clockwork
Description:
Published by and using 28mm miniatures by Eureka Miniatures in Australia, this abstract boardgame is set in their Pax Limpopo universe. The British lancers can only move diagonally forward. The clockwork Russian pigs can only move orthogonally like a rook (again, never backward). The abandoned, unhappy horses are terrain pieces but can be moved like a pawn (but into any of the eight squares around it) if the dice are right. Movement is blocked by the horses, your opponent's pieces and your own pieces. However, if you can end a move on an opponent's piece, it is removed from the game. The first player to get three of his pieces to his opponent's start line (or prevents his opponent from winning) wins the game.

Each turn, two six-sided dice are rolled and the results, like in backgammon, can move one or two of your pieces. On a result of doubles, a player can move one horse and then take his regular move, or on any result of one, can move a horse instead of moving one of his pieces.

The game comes with a full colour 11" x 17" board (not mounted), 6 British Lancers on unicycles, 6 Russian clockwork pigs, and 6 forlorn-looking horses sitting on their rumps. All figures come unpainted. The pigs must be assembled. There is a one-page instruction sheet with a "history" of the battle on the back.

Name: Horse Luck
Description:
The sassy pony named Lucky has again startled the horses at the “Happy Horses” farm. The horses take to their heels.
Who with a bit of luck and thought will be able to find most of their horses?

A memory game for 2-4 players.

Name: Hungry Wolves
Description:
Which is the best herding dog in the valley of the hungry wolves? Shouting “Woof!” and “Baa” the players move round the meadow. It’s now or never to catch up with the next dog and be the first to collect three sheep and win this romping die game for 2-4 players.

Hungry Wolves (Würfelwölfe) is a hectic action game with dice. The players circle a flock of sheep with their herding dogs. All players throw their dice simultaneously and have to perform an action as fast as possible depending on the dice throw, e.g. saying "Woof!" or running around the table. 
Also, the movement of the dog depends on the dice throw.

As soon as the action is performed, the dice throwing continues. When one dog reaches or overtakes another, the round ends and the faster dog gets a sheep from the flock as a reward.

The game is on the recommendation list of the SdJ-jury 2009.

Name: The Color Dwarfs
Description:
The children walk with dwarf Colorful through the vivid Colorland. They visit the red dwarf, the green one ...Who will be the first to collect the presents?

A fantastic educational game collection for 2-4 players about recognizing and classifying colors.

Includes co-operative variation which also can be played solo.

Name: The Wooly Ladder
Description:
Whoever, after a couple of Ups and Downs is the first to reach pink sheep Rosemary, wins the game.

A classic competition race for 2-4 players.

Travel games:
• Popular classic games in a suitcase
• Ideal for long journeys by car, train or airplane
• Magnetic game figures: nothing lost between the seats!
• Game board inside lid
• Suitcase is the packaging

Name: Más Absolutas Idioteces
Description:
After ´Balderdash´ and ´Beyond Balderdash´, comes ´More Beyond Balderdash´ (Más Absolutas Idioteces). This game is the third edition in the series and it´s all in Spanish.

The game is based on bluffing your opponents into guessing your false definitions to obscure words. The real answers are often even more outrageous than the bluffs, so the game offers plenty of laughs.


From Spanish publisher:

Más Absolutas Idioteces es un juego absolutamente divertido donde podrás farolear delante de tus adversarios para intentar convencerles de que tu respuesta es la correcta.

El juego contiene preguntas de la vida cotidiana que nos hacemos todos los días y nunca nos preguntamos por su respuesta o de dónde vienen.

Esta nueva versión contiene una nueva categoría especial de misterios de la vida sin solución… todo queda en manos de tu poder de convicción.

Contenido:

- 960 preguntas en 320 tarjetas
- 1 bloc de anotación
- 6 cartones porta tarjetas
- 42 fichas de puntuación
- Instrucciones
- 1 dado

Name: Witch Dice
Description:
Lion, Lisa, London – Who is quick at finding words with the letter being searched for?

A bewitching word game collection for 2-8 players ages Ages 7 and up.

Name: Tactical Football
Description:
Early dice based football game. Has only 4 types of plays that may be run;  Forward Pass, Line Buck, Trick Play and Kick.

Uses 7 custom dice, 4 for the offensive player 3 for the defense.  After rolling you look up the result on a chart.

Name: I Spy Eagle Eye Junior
Description:
See the words! Match the pictures! Ring the bell! Everyone wins!
A new version of the hit game I Spy Eagle Eye, scaled to suit the youngest I Spy fans.

4 levels of play

Helps develop language skills, word association, matching like and similar objects and social skills

Name: I spy Flip 5
Description:
For the speedy spy on the go! Just flip 5 picture tokens and search for matches. With pictures on both sides, it's never the same game twice!

The first player to win 5 rounds is the game winner.

Easily portable box makes this a great travel game!

4 versions of play
Helps develop observation, dexterity and social skills

Name: I Spy Ready, Set, Silhouette
Description:
It takes a keen eye and a quick hand to keep up in this fast-paced matching game.

Search the colorful picture cards to find the one that matches the silhouette card in hand.

Player with the most matches wins!

4 levels of play

Helps develop visual discrimination, critical thinking and social skills

Name: Dino Flip 5
Description:
Be the dinosaur hunter to find the most matching pairs! But be observant...the matches aren't exact. Flip the tokens as you play to make a constantly changing game.

The better you know your dinos, the faster you'll be. The game comes with a guide to the featured creatures.

Handy, portable box makes this a great game to take on trips.

3 ways to play
Develops observation, memory and matching skills

Name: I Spy Private Eye
Description: Become an I Spy Private Eye.....can you remember what you spy? Shake up the cubes,press the timer and go! You have 30 seconds to spy the I Spy images on all 9-picture cubes before they are hidden from view. "Beep,Beep!"...times up! Examine the evidence. Choose one I Spy picture card and find all the images that match the cubes and score points....but watch out for a challenge!

Name: I Spy Memory Game: Travel Edition
Description:
Your favorite I Spy Memory Game in a take-along, travel-size version. All new cards for new memory and matching fun! Made your matches? Now solve the 5 new riddles.

The game uses the classic I Spy photography of Walter Wick as the basis for two styles of play. Younger children can simply match the images on two different cards while older players can find the images that correspond to various riddles.

New riddles versus the full-sized edition, but only about a third as many tiles.
Families: Versions & Editions: Travel Versions of Non-Travel Games

Name: Animal Soup Game: There's Always One!
Description: The kooky critters of Animal Soup love playing together in their silly soup bowl. But guess what? They love it even more when you find one-of-a-kind pictures of their friends so you can fish them out of the soup!

Name: Green Eggs and Ham: Speedy Diner!
Description:
The fast-paced frenetically fun food game

Sam-I-Am has opened a café and invited his friends, Fox, Mouse, and Goat, for dinner. Help serve up his signature green eggs and ham along with a menu full of other silly Seussian foods. Listen closely because these critter customers can’t decide what to eat! And hurry, hurry, hurry—the musical timer is playing and speedy service is the key to 5-star success!

In this fast-paced, frenetically fun game for preschoolers, players work together to deliver food to the café guests as fast as they can. Take turns being the Chef calling out orders to the other players, who serve as waiters, running back and forth to pick up the foods and deliver them to the correct customers. The faster you deliver the food, the more tips you’ll make! But watch out—when you hear “Bugs in the Kitchen!” you’ve got to race back to the dining room and check all the tables for insects. Players use color, shape and other pre-reading skills to identify food items and counting to collect their reward coins.

Inspired by the classic Dr. Seuss children’s story, Green Eggs & Ham - Speedy Diner! Game serves up big laughs and fast-action role-play fun. The whimsical Musical Menu Book helps kids make the association between letters and words, inspiring confidence and a love for reading.

Name: Dr. Seuss: Oh the Places You'll Go! Game
Description:
Your future is full of exciting possibilities! What will you do?

Take a wild adventure through life's twisty-turns and tough choices to discover a world of future possibilities. Along the way, try to guess what future your friends and family will choose!

The wise and whimsical book by Dr. Seuss comes to life in this playful game for all ages. The perfect gift for someone celebrating an important milestone—like graduating from grade school or moving to a new town—this game gets the whole family thinking about the future and all its wondrous possibilities.

Name: Oh the Wondrous Places You'll Go! Travel Card Game
Description:
Start imagining your wondrous journey!

Tickle your travel bug with this deck of cards describing 51½ wondrous places you can go! Each card features stunning photography, unbelievable facts, surprising history, and brain-twisting trivia about a multitude of amazing destinations.

Easy to store and tote, Oh the Wondrous Places You'll Go! Game is the perfect family entertainment for road trips, air travel, a rainy day—or for any time you're craving a little excitement. From famous landmarks to hidden gems, a world of adventure awaits!

Name: Curious George: Super Helper Game
Description:
The game of ball bouncing, dice tumbling, coin flipping fun!

You can be a neighborhood Super Helper just like Curious George! Volunteer at the firehouse, pitch in at the restaurant, or help tidy up at home. Flip over three cards to see who needs help. Chose where you want to help—at home, the firehouse, or the restaurant—then drop the ball, coin, or cube into the tower and try to make a match!

The bouncy ball, flippy coin, and dice cube tumble through the roof of the tower and magically come out on different sides. The player who helps the most wins the game.

Super Helper game prize stickers add to the fun!

Name: Curious George: Hide and Seek Zoo Game
Description:
The wild game of hiding, seeking, and zoo-keeping fun!

Your favorite monkey is in charge of the zoo and everything is going wild!

Grab your "walkie talkie" and get ready: The man with the yellow hat will be calling in to send you on exciting missions all over the zoo. Feed and care for zoo animals, repair fences, and clean up messes. But watch out—when you hear “THE ANIMALS HAVE ESCAPED,” it’s time to spring into action! The other players put on their animal masks and hide. It’s your job to find them. But hurry—the zoo must open on time!

Join Curious George for some playful problem-solving and up-on-your-feet hide-and-go-seek fun!

Available at Target, target.com, and specialty retail outlets.

Name: Majority
Description:
In Majority, each player represents a political party in an unnamed parliament. There are 15 political issues represented by cards - each party has a platform of 10 that they are interested in passing bills about, with varying point values.

On each turn a player proposes a bill and attempts to get a majority for it - if this happens the parties interested in the issue score points. There are also event cards which can change the number of seats held by the parties, etc.

Contents:

     60 political platform cards
     50 event cards
     6 pawns
     1 game board
     1 die
     1 set of rules (in Dutch, French, and English)

Name: Island Invasion: Amphibious Assault Game
Description:
Island Invasion is a simple game about the American invasion of Guam in World War II (the rules do not give the name of the island, but it is clearly Guam from the map, not to mention the publisher had an office there). The American player starts with 6 landing craft approaching the island, and must land them in the face of artillery and pillbox fire from the Japanese. Once the Americans have landed, the soldiers can capture each other.

Contents:

     14 plastic American soldiers
     14 plastic Japanese soldiers
     6 landing craft counters
     2 dice
     1 board
     1 set of English rules
     1 set of Japanese rules

Name: Backseat Drawing Junior
Description:
From back of box (not a neutral description):

Backseat Drawing Junior brings the outrageous fun of Backseat Drawing to the entire family.  Players race to identify a drawing done by the "artist" - but the artist doesn't know what he or she is drawing!  It's up to the "director" to tell the artist how to draw the picture without giving away the name of the item shown on the picture card.

The laughter builds as the artist attempts to follow directions and everyone tries to identify the drawing.  With Backseat Drawing Junior everyone can play and the fun never stops!

Re-implements: Backseat Drawing

Name: Manifest Railways
Description:
The game again takes place in the Industrial Northeast as the owner of one of four major railroads.  Your objective is to build westward and take advantage of resources that you may place along the way.  You draw a set of tiles and use capital and resource tiles.  The game takes place in three separate ages, a Silver, Golden and Rust age.  VP are earned by the types of resources claimed by your company routes versus the age you are ending, VP for making it to Chicago, VP for each city you are connected to and VP for being a railroad built furthest to the west.

Resources degrade over time and resources and track rights are hotly contested throughout the game.

Manifest Railways can be found here:

http://www.jkntech.com/blog/page/Manifest-Railways-Board-Game.aspx

Name: Horse Race Derby
Description: A horse racing game on a lithographed tin.  Players roll marbles into indentations in the center of the lid, and move their magnetic horses the appropriate distance around the outer track.

Name: WUPS! Unabridged Edition
Description:
From the box...

The Adult Jigsaw Grossword Puzzle Game

WUPS! is a game wherein some words of Anglo Saxon origin may be formed which are considered slang or vulgarisms.  While it is the object of the game not to form such words, it frequently happens.  These words may refer to body parts or body functions.

The game comprises a box containing a shelf with a round hole in it and a 36-piece jigsaw puzzle.  The jigsaw puzzle has sixty four letter words on it in a crossword puzzle grid.  Some of the words are repeats.  The same sixty words are on each side of the puzzle and the puzzle is cut so that the words are divided in half.  Many of the edge pieces may be interchanged and all of the interior pieces are interchangeable. The corner pieces are unique.  As players take turns reassembling the puzzle with pieces chosen at random, some embarrassing words may be formed.  The winner is the player who makes the fewest "naughty" words.

Name: Bakugan Battle Brawlers Skill & Action Game
Description:
Description: You and your opponents become the ultimate Battle Brawlers and must save the Bakugan that are trapped in Vestroia!

Release the Rods that trap them, and catch them as the plummet down to Earth!

Catch as many Bakugan Balls with the gaming scoops, be the first player to build your Gate Card puzzle and win!

Warning! Beware of Hydranoid.

Object of the Game: Be the first player to catch enough Bakugan Balls(Marbles) to complete your Gate Card Puzzle, 4 pieces.

Play Summary:  One Player pull a rods out of Vestroia (the tower) which will release Bakugan Balls (Marbles).  The players whose turn it is try to catch these Bakugan Balls with the two game scoops, if he catches the ball before it stops rolling the player gets a Puzzle piece for his Gate card puzzle.  One of the Balls is the evil Hydranoid (the black marble), if you catch the Hydranoid you lose a gate piece. Scoops are passed clock wise and play continues until one of the players wins.  When all size Marbles are released from the tower return all the rods and marbles and continue playing until you have a winner.

Not the CCG/CMG (Collectible Marble Game?) but a stand alone board game with a very similar title and theme.

Name: HIJACK
Description:
HIJACK is a roll and move game, players are long haul truck drivers, picking up and dropping off loads at different cities in the US and Canada, making a living and avoiding HIJACK.

The board is a map of northern North America, part of Mexico is shown, but the paths between cities do not go there.  Most cities have two or three paths leading to/from them, but some (Detroit, Jacksonville, New Orleans) only have one way in or out. Spaces on the paths reward or penalize players, moving your Big Rig back or forward spaces, rewarding your good deeds with cash, or fining you for speeding, for instance.

There are three decks of cards, Load, Partial Load, and Destination.

A pack of money, printed for the game.

There are 4 Trailer Title cards, 4 Truck Insurance cards, and 4 wooden Big Rigs, apparently cut out by a band saw.

There are also two other wooden pieces, I think these are tractors minus their trailers.

Professionally printed (it has a bar code), no designer, artist or publisher credits.  No rules in the only copy I have found.

I have a copy of this game I found going through my archive. The publisher is LAD Game Company, PO Box 926, Salem, OR 97308. I suspect I purchased this new from my FLGS (which has been out of business for over 25 years). My copy only has 4 tractor pieces, no trailers.

UPDATE.

I know the person/people that made this game. I will update with instructions pictures to follow. I will also add different pictures showing actual game pieces in the coming days.

Name: Garbo
Description:
Card game from David Parlett played on 2 levels:

Aim of the game:

To place cards in a 4 x 4 grid in such a way as to avoid duplicating the suit of an adjacent card and the rank of a card in the same row or column. Any such match of suit or rank gives away points to one's opponent.

Ancestor of Zoo Party

Name: Roll 'n Subtract
Description:
The Game of Subtraction, Strategy and Fun!

Learn how to subtract numbers the Roll ’n Subtract fun way! It is easier than you think! Play with your friends while learning subtraction- challenge your friends while learning strategies.

Simply roll the dice, subtract the numbers, check your answer against the subtraction table, and start building a triangle. The real fun starts when you plan a strategy and capture your opponent’s playing pieces!

Name: Íslenska efnahagsspilið
Description: A Monopoly like game, where players try to gather as much money as possible during the game. Duration is variable, with players deciding at the start of the game what the criteria is for the game ending (amount of money, elapsed time etc.) A single track runs round the board with four off-shots (trade, car-trade, fishery and stock exchange) at each corner. Players can buy lots and build properties and inflation plays part in whether they can sell their properties with profit or not.

Name: Meistarinn
Description: A trivia game based on the tv show Meistarinn (The Maestro). In the tv show, two participants are pitted against each other trying to win the grand prize. The game is for 2-4 players but uses similar rules as the tv show.

Name: Stúdentinn
Description: A single track game with 125 spaces, similar to The Game of Life, where start in childrens school and try to finish as college graduates the quickest. There are 25 special spaces that are similar to the Snake & Ladders game, where you can move forward or backwards.

Name: Inter Biss
Description:
The game contains a playing board with four squares (countries!) depicted on it. Each country has 16 playing fields:

2 orange fields: an airport with international connections and a national airport
1 yellow field: holiday resort
9 red fields: pieces of land meant for the founding of companies
4 green fields: follow the instructions or directions

The game is similar to Monopoly.

Name: Scrabble Valentine's Day
Description:
Special Valentine's Day version of Scrabble.  Comes in a box similar to a heart shaped box of chocolates.  Contains smaller heart shaped board (kind of a blocky heart shape, since it is made of squares) and 100 Letter Tiles.

Play is like normal Scrabble, with the addition of a list of 12 romantic themed words, that if used, scores an additional 4 point bonus in addition to normal tile and grid space scoring.

Also included in the game are adhesive dots and a Scrabble and Valentine's Day themed greeting card, so that you could use some of the tiles to spell out a message on the greeting card for your loved one.

Name: Evolution in the Box
Description:
The history of mankind is just starting. First antecedents of man are entering the scene full of wild prehistoric plants and bizarre creatures. You are one of them, a leader of a large group of anthropoids. A mysterious force of evolution makes you grow, multi-play and evolve at surprisingly high speed. For a quick evolution you need a lot of meat so you focus on hunting mammoths. The more mammoths you hunt down, the more quickly your brain grows.
With a bigger brain you can do more things… You can improve your hunting skills and face your enemies more successfully. The best hunters will achieve the desired goal of evolution, becoming a modern human – and thus securing immortality of their species. Those less successful, whose development froze at a lower level of evolution, can at least go to have a chat with their relatives in a zoo.

Brief summary of the game, the goal and the end of the game:
The player determines by means of the cards of commands, where his pack should go. Packs go across the landscapes and they try to hunt down as many mammoths as possible (by going across cards with pictures of mammoths on them), so that they have proteins to grow their brains more quickly and to rise on the evolutionary meter. By doing this the skills of the pack will grow and evolutionary advantages can be acquired. The winner of the game is the person who will be the first to complete his evolution by reaching the level of a human homo-sapiens. At this moment the game ends.

Name: Yotta Know Mammals
Description:
Part of a series of "Yotta Know..." games on different topics, Yotta Know Mammals is a game played on a six-by-six grid board on which players place cards depicting mammals to be identified. The first player to identify seven mammals wins the round. Rolling dice adds a randomizing element to gameplay, while a handicap system allows players of varying knowledge levels to play against each other.
 The game uses a deck of 63 mammals, all of which are found in North America.
  Expanded by: 

    Yotta Know Birds
    Yotta Know Waterfowl

Name: Yotta Know Waterfowl
Description:
Part of a series of "Yotta Know..." games on different topics, Yotta Know Waterfowl is a game played on a six-by-six grid board on which players place cards depicting birds to be identified. The first player to identify seven waterfowl wins the round. Rolling dice adds a randomizing element to gameplay, while a handicap system allows players of varying knowledge levels to play against each other.
 The game uses a deck of 54 waterfowl, all of which are found in North America.
  Expanded by: 

    Yotta Know Birds
    Yotta Know Mammals

Name: Bild-A-Word
Description:
A very early word card game.  Its deck has 36 cards, all with letters except for two Blockade Cards, which just take up space in the hand without being usable.  It also includes cardboard chits labeled "5 Points" or "10 Points"; some editions include a pocket dictionary.  The rules describe five games:

Original Bild-A-Word: 5 cards each are dealt.  In the first round, each player in turn lays 1-2 words of 2+ letters on the table, or adds letters to an existing word (rearranging if needed) to make a new word, or passes.  From then on, a turn starts by drawing 1 card and ends with discarding 1 card; if the draw pile runs out, shuffle the discards to restock it.  The hand ends when a player empties his hand, and he scores 5 points per cards held in others' hands -- the point chits are used to keep score.  250 points wins the game.

Bild-A-Word Triplets: Like the Original game, except that after the deal, 3 cards are placed in separate rows on the table.  Players may not start new words, but only try to add to the existing rows to make new words.  Letters may be rearranged within a row but not moved between rows.

Bild-A-Word Marathon:  8 cards are dealt to the table.  In each turn, a player makes a word out of any 2 or more letters on the table.  They may not repeat previous words, and have only 1 minute per turn.  When a player is stumped they are out; the winner is the last player to come up with a word.

Bild-A-Word Wits: Like 5 card draw poker with words.  Players start with 100 points worth of Point chits, and win on getting 300 points worth.  Hands are ranked by the length of the words in them: 5 letters; 4; 3&2; 3; 2&2; 2.  Ties are broken by the letters earliest in the alphabet.

Bild-A-Word Quinto: Like gin rummy.  Players start with 5 cards, and in a turn draw 1 and discard 1.  The first to make a 5-letter word from his hand calls "Quinto" and lays his hand down.  All other players lay down their hands and make the longest word they can; the winner gets 5 point for each unused card.  Game is 250.

Name: AlphaBet
Description:
Texas Hold-Em with words.  The deck has 83 cards each with a letter and value of 1-8.

All start with an equal number of chips.  There is a typical order: ante; deal 3 "hole" cards to each player; a round of betting; 2 "flop" cards face up in the middle; betting; 1 more face up (the "turn"); betting; 1 last card face up (the "river"); betting; the showdown.  The players who haven't folded make their highest scoring word from their hole and the common cards; if a word has 6 letters, its value is doubled, if 7, it is tripled.  Highest score wins the pot; if a tie, the pot is shared.

Name: Prince Little's Marble Bowling Contest
Description: Players aim at the targets and try to knock them off the target either by simply rolling the marble or by using the thumb as in other marble games. Highest score wins. Game comes with 2 long wooden sections and 6 characters that are hung on the frame and serve as targets.

Name: Maisy Lotto
Description:
Maisy Lotto is a childrens lotto aimed at rather younger children than most lottos - with just 4 pictures per board, instead of the usual 9.  This makes it an ideal starter lotto for younger children - in fact by the time they reach the 3+ range indicated on the box, they are probably too old for this and ready for regular childrens lotto games.

The pictures come from the popular Maisy stories, and the boards are brightly coloured red, blue, yellow and green.

Name: The House that Jack Built
Description:
A simple yet most enjoyable game for children Ages 4 - 8.  2-4 can play, or a child can amuse himself playing alone.

The pieces are placed face up in the centre of the table.  Throw the coloured die in turn.  If you throw white, you take a white front wall; if you throw any other colour before you possess your front wall you pass.  Once you have this you take pieces that match the colour you throw.  If you throw a colour you do not require, you pass.  The first player to complete his house wins the game.

Name: Die wilden Schwäne
Description:
Which child will get the most swans?

The 9 swans start at one end of the board and each player chooses a child to be.  In turn each player rolls the dice and moves along the track of the appropriate colour from lily pad to lily pad.  If you roll purple you may move any swan one space.  The aim is to move the swans on to the beach where your child is standing.  When all swans have reached the beach the game ends and the player whose child has the most swans is the winner.

Name: Completly Veggie
Description:
Fast little card and token game where you need to buy vegetable seeds at the market, grow them every turn and sell them for profit without the other players ruining it for you.
The player that manage his gold the better and get the most cash by the end of the year wins the game.

Name: Astro
Description: This is an astrological game, revolving around the twelve signs of the Zodiac. Based on the roll of a die, actions on the Astrocards and the player's purchases during the game, a personality description is finally constructed which fits each player. In addition the numbers that players purchase during the game decide the winner of the game.

Name: Plus Minus
Description:
The game consists of a dice cup like in Yahtzee, with 6 ordinary dice, a timer, a notepad and a pencil.

Players roll the 6 dice and then everyone must use all 6 numbers to reach a particular score before the timer runs out.

You start with 1, and move on progressively to 2, 3, and so forth until 10. The first player to successfully reach 10 wins the game.

Each of the 6 numbers must be used exactly once, and you may Add, Subtract, Multiply or Divide as you please!

When the time's up you check whose calculation is actually correct. This player moves on to the next target score. Everyone else must redo the score they just failed.

Name: Útrásarvíkingaspilið
Description: A spoof game about the so called 'Financial Vikings' of Iceland. The board is only 14 spaces (including the starting space) and players roll two die to get to space 13. If the player doesn't get 13 on the roll, he moves from space to space until he ends up on the beginning space again. If the player gets 13 he's done the impossible and won the game.

Name: Kreuzworträtsel-Spiel
Description:
The title means "Crossword Puzzle Game", and it matches that description very closely.  [The rules were in German, but I believe I have the gist of it.]

The game is for two players or teams.  There are 2 decks of 60 cards, one red and one blue.  Each has 45 letters and 15 blocks -- which show a checkerboard but stand for the filled-in squares between the words in an actual crossword puzzle.

Each side shuffles their letter cards and draws a hand of 10 cards.  The first player lays out a word from their hand horizontally, places a block card at either end of the word, and draws back up to 10.  The opponent then places a word vertically, using one of the existing letters as part of it, also capping its end with block cards.  Play continues in this manner, one side doing horizontal words, the other vertical, forming a typical crossword.  Only one word can be done per turn.  A word may be lengthened instead, the block being removed and replaced at the end of the longer word.  If a player cannot play he passes.

The game ends when a side runs out of cards, or neither side can make a new word.  The winner is the one with the most cards played.

Name: Verbum Est
Description:
A word card game, whose deck has 85 cards, each with a letter and its value.

In the basic game, a player's turn consists of turning over 3 letters face up in order, and naming as many words as they can that contain those 3 letters in that order.  Example: with PAT, you could name sPAT, PArT, sePAraTe, etc.  Then the score is the sum of the cards' values time the number of words stated.  There is a maximum of 5 words, and a time limit is recommended for the turns.  If the player thinks no word is possible he declares a Stymie, and if no one else can think of a word he gets 100 points; if someone can, she gets 50 points while the declarer loses 50.  After the deck runs out, highest total wins.

There are several variations:

1. Juniors - For younger players, use 2 cards instead.

2. Sliders - use 2 cards, and only 5-letter words with both letters adjacent are allowed, one each of XXxxx, xXXxx, xxXXx, and xxxXX.

3. Twos - Use 2 cards, and think of any number of words (up to ten), of any length, with both letters adjacent.

4. Famous Names - Use 2 cards, and try to think of a famous name with those initials.

5. Initials - Use 2 cards, and think of a phrase, or two related words, the begin with those two letters.  (E.g., with MD, Medical Doctor.)

6. Solitaire - use 3 cards, and find only 1 word per triple; try to find one for each triple dealt.

7. Charades - Use 2 cards, and act out a phrase starting with those two letters.

Name: Making Money
Description:
The game is called Making Money, and the goal as you can imagine is to make as much money as you can, anyway you can. This is done by moving around the streets of a city while buying up and developing property. Money can also be made by buying and selling stocks that go up and down in value.

While the game involves some chance from drawing cards and rolling dice, without a good strategy you will quickly find yourself well on your way to financial ruin. The game is very easy to learn and during play testing has been a lot of fun! To win the game, simply keep making money while trying to stay ahead of everyone else. The game is played for a set number of rounds and the player with the most money at the end wins.

I welcome everyone and anyone to jump in, give feedback, and play test if you can. Play testing takes place in New York City, upcoming dates and locations can be found on our website, link is below in this listing.

Name: Stonehenge Rocks!
Description:
Inspired by Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game and Spinal Tap, Stonehenge Rocks! puts the players in charge of helping concert-goers vie for the best seats at a rock (tee hee) concert.  Players take turns moving fans or seating a fan, then optionally moving the security guard, who maintains order (gets in the way, man!) in the busy venue.  Players try to seat fans in box seats for 3 points each, seat them on a trilithon for 2 points each, and/or collect T-shirts for 1 point each.  The game ends once a player ends her turn with 20 or more points, winning the game.

Stonehenge Rocks! is an official game for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game.

Name: Rolling Rocks
Description: First published as part of the Stonehenge: Bonusspiele #1 anthology as Rollende Steine, Rolling Rocks is sort of a tabletop, Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game golf.  The players act as a team of Celtic giants, entertaining themselves by rolling rocks through the trilithons.  The method by which she rolls her stone each turn is entirely up to the player, be it flicking, using a stick for leverage, or even blowing on it.  In addition to the dexterity element, players are granted the opportunity to place and move sticks on the board in order to attempt to guide their wayward stones.

Name: Nemcol
Description:
This is a quasi-word game that is unique in several aspects: the words used are personal names; the cards stand only for vowels; everyone is working on the same word at once.

It has a 52-card deck, each of which has a vowel (AEIOU) or semi-vowel (WY), a number value, and a list of names that use that vowel.  The 52nd card, though, is a Substitute card which can stand for any vowel.

Seven cards are dealt to each player.  On his turn a player declares and spells a personal name, and then everyone must discard the vowels in that name.  For example, if he says "Andrew", everyone in turn must discard an A card, then each must discard an E, then each must discard a W.  Any player who cannot discard the current letter must draw from the draw pile, and discard it if it's the right letter, or keep it if not.  The discard pile is reshuffled to replenish the draw pile, if needed.

A player goes out on playing his last card in hand, except that the caller cannot go out until the name he called is finished.  When a hand is over, each player scores the sum of the cards still in hand.  Play until someone reaches an agreed total, at which point the lowest total wins.

Name: The High Council
Description: First published as part of the Stonehenge: Bonusspiele #1 anthology as Der Hohe Rat, The High Council is a political game for Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game.  Each faction vies to form a contiguous block (comprising speakers and supporters) in the council of 16 seats.  This constitutes a contiguous majority - a mighty force.

Name: A Grand Endeavor
Description: First published as part of the Stonehenge: Bonusspiele #1 anthology as Erbaut Stonehenge!, A Grand Endeavor has seen subsequent development.  (For example, as originally published, it was for 3-4 players.)  This Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game game focuses on the actual construction of Stonehenge.  In each player's turn, she has a construction phase, a draw phase, and a commit phase during which she may commit to a project.  There is opportunity for spite in A Grand Endeavor, as a player may choose to defame another faction's character, setting that player back a little.  Once Stonehenge is completely constructed, the game ends, and players are awarded points for their works, with some bonus points for adjacency.

Name: Trilithen Knallen
Description: First published as part of the Stonehenge: Bonusspiele #1 anthology as Trilithen Knallen is a demolition derby amongst druids, staged at Stonehenge.  This unusual Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game game is most certainly an elimination game, as druids attempt to deal as much damage as possible while staying in the race.

Name: Sacrifice Roulette
Description: First published as part of the Stonehenge: Bonusspiele #1 anthology as Opferroulette, Sacrifice Roulette is an official Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game game of luck.  Players essentially bet on priests, which are gradually eliminated through the course of the game by a roulette-style mechanism.

Name: Pixie Play Tray
Description:
This is a collection of three card games and a tray to play them in.  The cards are square and of thick cardstock.  The plastic tray has 3x3 playing area of recessed squares -- to allow stacking while preventing slippage ("great car fun") -- and a deeper square to the side for the draw pile.

Each game has its own small deck, and in each game players take turns drawing a card and playing it onto the 3x3 board.

1. Wiggle Worm: There are 2 head cards that start at opposite corners; the rest of the cards show parts of one or two worm bodies that pass through the card.  A connection game, where you race to build you worm up to 5 squares long.

2. Cross Word: Each card has a letter, which you may play on any space, occupied or not.  If you complete a word across or down, you get 1 point; if you complete a word in both directions, you get 3 points.  Most points when the deck runs out wins.

3. Tick-Tack Whoa: Tic-Tac-Toe, with special "Whoa" cards. You may not play an X on an O or vice versa, but you may play a Whoa card on either one, to prevent your opponent getting 3 in a row, and to free up the space for your cards.

Name: Last Gamble: The Battle of the Bulge
Description:
Last Gamble: The Battle of the Bulge is a division-level game covering the first two weeks of the battle in the Ardennes Forest in December, 1944. The game system is based on DDH Games' successful June '44: The Struggle for Normandy, 1944.

Components include:

1 12-page full-color rulebook
1 11 x 17" Map
1 sheet of 120 die-cut counters
1 Player Aid Card
1 Game Track Card
1 10-sided die
24 event cards

The game is fast playing and highly competitive, but very easy to learn and suitable for beginning wargamers. It's also very suitable for solo play.
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

Name: August '44
Description:
August '44 is the expansion to 'June '44: The Struggle for Normandy, 1944' and is not a stand-alone game.

With both, now players can play the entire Normandy campaign from 6 June to mid-August. It also includes a 'COBRA' scenario to play from the breakout of late July on.

The expansion game includes the following components:

4-page Rules & scenario booklet
1 new 11 x 17" map
1 new Player aid card
6 new cards
40 new counters

Republished in Command Magazine Japan #95 in 2010.

Name: The World Cup Game:  Expansion Set 5
Description: Released in April 2009. This is the last in the series of Expansion sets which includes the World Cup tournaments of Switzerland 1954, Mexico 1970 and France 1998. Also included are a set of flag stickers to create extra flag tiles, useful for the 1950, 1974, 1978 and 1982 games from Expansions 3 and 4. Finally, a complete summary chart for all the extra rules for all expansions will be in this expansion set too. Now you can play a complete World Cup history!!

Name: Átthagaspilið: Vopnafjörður
Description: This trivia game is concentrated on the authors hometown in Iceland, Vopnafjörður. Includes a board with a spiraling track from the edge inwards. Three types of cards are included; questions (players get the card if they answer correctly), information (informative text only) and opportunity (both good and bad). Players progress along the track by the roll of a die.

Name: Víkingaskák
Description: A chess variant designed in 1967 by an Icelandic carpenter. Played on a grid of 85 hexagonal spaces, in 9 rows, the spaces being in three colours. There are 18 white and 18 black pieces which are the same as in traditional chess with one new type, the viking, which starts between the king and the queen. The pieces move in the same way as in traditional chess (more or less).

Name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Mountains of Madness Asylum Pack
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Mountains of Madness is themed around the H.P. Lovecraft short novel of the same name about a doomed Miskatonic University research expedition to Antarctica. This Asylum Pack – a supplemental set of 40 fixed cards for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – features Polar events, Alaskan Sledge Dogs, Antarctic Monsters, and more!

Update, 2010:

For the second printing of The Mountains of Madness, FFG is updating this expansion from 40 cards to 60 cards (three copies each of 20 different cards). The card text has also been updated where needed to account for the most recent FAQ and errata.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Call of Cthulhu – The Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Ancient Horrors Asylum Pack
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

Ancient Horrors centers around Monsters, Ancient Ones, and the brave (or insane) hunters that stalk them. Both Investigators and servitors of the Mythos will find powerful allies in this pack, such as Ghoulish Worshipper, Safari Hunter, Aspiring Artist, and new Ancient Ones Bokrug, Ghatanothoa, Atlach-Nacha, and others.

This Asylum Pack – a supplemental set of 40 fixed cards for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – features five new Ancient One characters and the investigators who track them, all designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

Update, 2011:

For the second printing of Ancient Horrors, FFG is updating this expansion from 40 cards to 60 cards (three copies each of 20 different cards). The card text has also been updated where needed to account for the most recent FAQ and errata.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Call of Cthulhu – The Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
